property.name: hadoop.tmp.dir
property.description: A base for other temporary directories.

property.name: hadoop.logfile.size
property.description: The max size of each log file

property.name: hadoop.logfile.count
property.description: The max number of log files

property.name: dfs.namenode.logging.level
property.description: The logging level for dfs namenode. Other values are "dir"(trac e namespace mutations), "block"(trace block under/over replications and block creations/deletions), or "all".

property.name: io.sort.factor
property.description: The number of streams to merge at once while sorting files. This determines the number of open file handles.

property.name: io.sort.mb
property.description: The total amount of buffer memory to use while sorting files, in megabytes. By default, gives each merge stream 1MB, which should minimize seeks.

property.name: io.file.buffer.size
property.description: The size of buffer for use in sequence files. The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is buffered during read and write operations.

property.name: io.bytes.per.checksum
property.description: The number of bytes per checksum. Must not be larger than io.file.buffer.size.

property.name: io.skip.checksum.errors
property.description: If true, when a checksum error is encountered while reading a sequence file, entries are skipped, instead of throwing an exception.

property.name: io.map.index.skip
property.description: Number of index entries to skip between each entry. Zero by default. Setting this to values larger than zero can facilitate opening large map files using less memory.

property.name: io.compression.codecs
property.description: A list of the compression codec classes that can be used for compression/decompression.

property.name: fs.default.name
property.description: The name of the default file system. Either the literal string "local" or a host:port for DFS.

property.name: dfs.datanode.bindAddress
property.description: the address where the datanode will listen to.

property.name: dfs.datanode.port
property.description: The port number that the dfs datanode server uses as a starting point to look for a free port to listen on.

property.name: dfs.info.bindAddress
property.description: the address where the dfs namenode web ui will listen on.

property.name: dfs.info.port
property.description: The base port number for the dfs namenode web ui.

property.name: dfs.datanode.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a data node should report its IP address.

property.name: dfs.datanode.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a DataNode should use to determine the host name used by the NameNode for communication and display purposes.

property.name: dfs.default.chunk.view.size
property.description: The number of bytes to view for a file on the browser.

property.name: dfs.datanode.du.reserved
property.description: Reserved space in bytes. Always leave this much space free for non dfs use

property.name: dfs.datanode.du.pct
property.description: When calculating remaining space, only use this percentage of the real available space

property.name: dfs.name.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem the DFS name node should store the name table. If this is a comma-delimited list of directories then the name table is replicated in all of the directories, for redundancy.

property.name: dfs.client.buffer.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem an DFS client should store its blocks before it sends them to the datanode.

property.name: dfs.data.dir
property.description: Determines where on the local filesystem an DFS data node should store its blocks. If this is a comma-delimited list of directories, then data will be stored in all named directories, typically on different devices. Directories that do not exist are ignored.

property.name: dfs.replication
property.description: Default block replication. The actual number of replications can be specified when the file is created. The default is used if replication is not specified in create time.

property.name: dfs.replication.max
property.description: Maximal block replication.

property.name: dfs.replication.min
property.description: Minimal block replication.

property.name: dfs.block.size
property.description: The default block size for new files.

property.name: dfs.df.interval
property.description: Disk usage statistics refresh interval in msec.

property.name: dfs.client.block.write.retries
property.description: The number of retries for writing blocks to the data nodes, before we signal failure to the application.

property.name: dfs.blockreport.intervalMsec
property.description: Determines block reporting interval in milliseconds.

property.name: dfs.heartbeat.interval
property.description: Determines datanode heartbeat interval in seconds.

property.name: dfs.safemode.threshold.pct
property.description: Specifies the percentage of blocks that should satisfy the minimal replication requirement defined by dfs.replication.min. Values less than or equal to 0 mean not to start in safe mode. Values greater than 1 will make safe mode permanent.

property.name: dfs.safemode.extension
property.description: Determines extension of safe mode in milliseconds after the threshold level is reached.

property.name: mapred.job.tracker
property.description: The host and port that the MapReduce job tracker runs at. If "local", then jobs are run in-process as a single map and reduce task.

property.name: mapred.job.tracker.info.bindAddress
property.description: the address where the job tracker info webserver will be binded on.

property.name: mapred.job.tracker.info.port
property.description: The port that the MapReduce job tracker info webserver runs at.

property.name: mapred.task.tracker.report.bindAddress
property.description: the address where the maperd tracker report server will be binded on.

property.name: mapred.task.tracker.report.port
property.description: The port number that the MapReduce task tracker report server uses as a starting point to look for a free port to listen on.

property.name: mapred.local.dir
property.description: The local directory where MapReduce stores intermediate data files. May be a comma-separated list of directories on different devices in order to spread disk i/o. Directories that do not exist are ignored.

property.name: local.cache.size
property.description: The limit on the size of cache you want to keep, set by default to 10GB. This will act as a soft limit on the cache directory for out of band data.

property.name: mapred.system.dir
property.description: The shared directory where MapReduce stores control files.

property.name: mapred.temp.dir
property.description: A shared directory for temporary files.

property.name: mapred.local.dir.minspacestart
property.description: If the space in mapred.local.dir drops under this, do not ask for more tasks. Value in bytes.

property.name: mapred.local.dir.minspacekill
property.description: If the space in mapred.local.dir drops under this, do not ask more tasks until all the current ones have finished and cleaned up. Also, to save the rest of the tasks we have running, kill one of them, to clean up some space. Start with the reduce tasks, then go with the ones that have finished the least. Value in bytes.

property.name: mapred.map.tasks
property.description: The default number of map tasks per job. Typically set to a prime several times greater than number of available hosts. Ignored when mapred.job.tracker is "local".

property.name: mapred.reduce.tasks
property.description: The default number of reduce tasks per job. Typically set to a prime close to the number of available hosts. Ignored when mapred.job.tracker is "local".

property.name: mapred.reduce.parallel.copies
property.description: The default number of parallel transfers run by reduce during the copy(shuffle) phase.

property.name: mapred.task.timeout
property.description: The number of milliseconds before a task will be terminated if it neither reads an input, writes an output, nor updates its status string.

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.tasks.maximum
property.description: The maximum number of tasks that will be run simultaneously by a task tracker.

property.name: mapred.child.java.opts
property.description:
Java opts for the task tracker child processes. Subsumes 'mapred.child.heap.size' (If a mapred.child.heap.size value is found in a configuration, its maximum heap size will be used and a warning emitted that heap.size has been deprecated). Also, the following symbols, if present, will be interpolated: @taskid@ is replaced by current TaskID; and @port@ will be replaced by mapred.task.tracker.report.port + 1 (A second child will fail with a port-in-use if mapred.tasktracker.tasks.maximum is greater than one). Any other occurrences of '@' will go unchanged. For example, to enable verbose gc logging to a file named for the taskid in /tmp and to set the heap maximum to be a gigabyte, pass a 'value' of:
-Xmx1024m -verbose:gc -Xloggc:/tmp/@taskid@.gc

property.name: mapred.combine.buffer.size
property.description: The number of entries the combining collector caches before combining them and writing to disk.

property.name: mapred.speculative.execution
property.description: If true, then multiple instances of some map and reduce tasks may be executed in parallel.

property.name: mapred.min.split.size
property.description: The minimum size chunk that map input should be split into. Note that some file formats may have minimum split sizes that take priority over this setting.

property.name: mapred.submit.replication
property.description: The replication level for submitted job files. This should be around the square root of the number of nodes.

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.dns.interface
property.description: The name of the Network Interface from which a task tracker should report its IP address.

property.name: mapred.tasktracker.dns.nameserver
property.description: The host name or IP address of the name server (DNS) which a TaskTracker should use to determine the host name used by the JobTracker for communication and display purposes.

property.name: tasktracker.http.threads
property.description: The number of worker threads that for the http server. This is used for map output fetching

property.name: tasktracker.http.bindAddress
property.description: the address where the task tracker http server will be binded on.

property.name: tasktracker.http.port
property.description: The default port for task trackers to use as their http server.

property.name: keep.failed.task.files
property.description: Should the files for failed tasks be kept. This should only be used on jobs that are failing, because the storage is never reclaimed. It also prevents the map outputs from being erased from the reduce directory as they are consumed.

property.name: mapred.output.compress
property.description: Should the outputs of the reduces be compressed?

property.name: mapred.output.compression.codec
property.description: If the reduce outputs are compressed, how should they be compressed?

property.name: mapred.compress.map.output
property.description: Should the outputs of the maps be compressed before being sent across the network. Uses SequenceFile compression.

property.name: io.seqfile.compress.blocksize
property.description: The minimum block size for compression in block compressed SequenceFiles.

property.name: io.seqfile.lazydecompress
property.description: Should values of block-compressed SequenceFiles be decompressed only when necessary.

property.name: io.seqfile.sorter.recordlimit
property.description: The limit on number of records to be kept in memory in a spill in SequenceFiles.Sorter

property.name: io.seqfile.compression.type
property.description: The default compression type for SequenceFile.Writer.

property.name: mapred.userlog.num.splits
property.description: The number of fragments into which the user-log is to be split.

property.name: mapred.userlog.limit.kb
property.description: The maximum size of user-logs of each task.

property.name: mapred.userlog.purgesplits
property.description: Should the splits be purged disregarding the user-log size limit.

property.name: mapred.userlog.retain.hours
property.description: The maximum time, in hours, for which the user-logs are to be retained.

property.name: ipc.client.timeout
property.description: Defines the timeout for IPC calls in milliseconds.

property.name: ipc.client.idlethreshold
property.description: Defines the threshold number of connections after which connections will be inspected for idleness.

property.name: ipc.client.maxidletime
property.description: Defines the maximum idle time for a connected client after which it may be disconnected.

property.name: ipc.client.kill.max
property.description: Defines the maximum number of clients to disconnect in one go.

property.name: ipc.client.connection.maxidletime
property.description: The maximum time after which a client will bring down the connection to the server.

property.name: ipc.client.connect.max.retries
property.description: Indicates the number of retries a client will make to establish a server connection.

property.name: ipc.server.listen.queue.size
property.description: Indicates the length of the listen queue for servers accepting client connections.
